alert.note: Alert for Custer; Roger Mills; Washita (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 07 at 4:08AM CDT by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northern Washita, east central Roger Mills and Custer Counties through 500 AM CDT... At 408 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Butler to 6 miles northwest of Corn. Movement was east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Weatherford, Clinton, Arapaho, Hammon, Canute, Corn, Custer City, Butler, Bessie, Foss, Foss Reservoir and Stafford. This includes Interstate 40 between mile markers 43 and 86. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...<30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
